Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class RawNoise

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.RawNoise
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContinuousNoise, CyclicNoise, FoamNoise, HoneyNoise, PerlinNoise, SimplexNoise, ValueNoise
public abstract class RawNoise extends Object implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable
Defines the core operations to generate continuous noise with a specific algorithm, and declares what properties of noise are supported by that algorithm.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    RawNoise.Serializer
    Allows serializing RawNoise objects with RawNoise.Serializer.serialize(RawNoise) and deserializing them with RawNoise.Serializer.deserialize(String).

  • Method Details

    • getMinDimension

      public abstract int getMinDimension()
      Gets the minimum dimension supported by this generator, such as 2 for a generator that only is defined for flat surfaces, or 3 for one that is only defined for 3D or higher-dimensional spaces.
      Returns:
      the minimum supported dimension, from 2 to 6 inclusive

    • getMaxDimension

      public abstract int getMaxDimension()
      Gets the maximum dimension supported by this generator, such as 2 for a generator that only is defined for flat surfaces, or 6 for one that is defined up to the highest dimension this interface knows about (6D).
      Returns:
      the maximum supported dimension, from 2 to 6 inclusive

    • canUseSeed

      public abstract boolean canUseSeed()
      Returns true if this generator can be seeded with setSeed(int) (and if so, retrieved with getSeed()).
      Returns:
      true if setSeed(int) and getSeed() are supported, false if either isn't supported

    • getNoise

      public abstract float getNoise(float x)
      Gets 1D noise with a default or pre-set seed. Most noise algorithms don't behave as well in 1D, so a common approach for implementations is to delegate to one of the LineWobble methods.
      Parameters:
      x - x position; can be any finite float
      Returns:
      a noise value between -1.0f and 1.0f, both inclusive
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if 1D noise cannot be produced by this generator

    • getNoise

      public abstract float getNoise(float x, float y)
      Gets 2D noise with a default or pre-set seed.
      Parameters:
      x - x position; can be any finite float
      y - y position; can be any finite float
      Returns:
      a noise value between -1.0f and 1.0f, both inclusive
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if 2D noise cannot be produced by this generator

    • setSeed

      public abstract void setSeed(int seed)
      Sets the seed to the given int, if int seeds are supported. If canUseSeed() returns true, this must be implemented and must set the seed given an int input. If this generator cannot be seeded, this is permitted to either do nothing or throw an UnsupportedOperationException. If this operation allocates or is time-intensive, then that performance cost will be passed along to getNoiseWithSeed(float, int), since that calls this twice unless overridden. In the case where seeding is expensive to perform, setSeed() can still be implemented while canUseSeed() returns false. This makes the getNoiseWithSeed(float, int) methods avoid reseeding, and instead move their inputs around in space.
      Parameters:
      seed - an int seed, with no restrictions unless otherwise documented

    • getSeed

      public abstract int getSeed()
      Gets the current seed of the generator, as an int. If canUseSeed() returns true, this must be implemented, but if canUseSeed() returns false, this is permitted to either still be implemented (but typically only if it is time- or space-intensive to call getSeed()) or to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
      Returns:
      the current seed, as an int

    • getTag

      public abstract String getTag()
      Returns a String constant that should uniquely identify this RawNoise as well as possible; usually this is just the class name. If a duplicate tag is already registered and RawNoise.Serializer.register(RawNoise) attempts to register the same tag again, a message is printed to System.err. The default implementation returns the String (NO), which is already registered in Serializer to a null value. Implementing this is required for any usage of Serializer.
      Returns:
      a short String constant that identifies this RawNoise type

    • stringSerialize

      public abstract String stringSerialize()
      Produces a String that describes everything needed to recreate this RawNoise in full. This String can be read back in by stringDeserialize(String) to reassign the described state to another RawNoise. The syntax here should always start and end with the ` (backtick) character, which is typically used by stringDeserialize(String) to identify the portion of a String that can be read back. The ` character should not be otherwise used unless to serialize another RawNoise that this uses.
      Returns:
      a String that describes this RawNoise for serialization
      See Also:
      • RawNoise.Serializer wraps this method so registered RawNoise types can be deserialized.

    • stringDeserialize

      public abstract RawNoise stringDeserialize(String data)
      Given a serialized String produced by stringSerialize(), reassigns this RawNoise to have the described state from the given String. The serialized String must have been produced by the same class as this object is.
      Parameters:
      data - a serialized String, typically produced by stringSerialize()
      Returns:
      this RawNoise, after being modified (if possible)
      See Also:
      • RawNoise.Serializer uses this method to deserialize any registered RawNoise type.

    • copy

      public abstract RawNoise copy()
      Creates a copy of this RawNoise, which should be a deep copy for any mutable state but can be shallow for immutable types such as functions. This almost always just calls a copy constructor.
      The default implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException only. Implementors are strongly encouraged to implement this in general, and that is required to use an RawNoise class with RawNoise.Serializer.
      Returns:
      a copy of this RawNoise

    • getNoiseWithSeed

      public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, int seed)
      Gets 1D noise with a specific seed. If the seed cannot be retrieved or changed per-call, then this falls back to getNoise(float); you can check if this will happen with canUseSeed(). Most noise algorithms don't behave as well in 1D, so a common approach for implementations is to delegate to one of the LineWobble methods.
      Parameters:
      x - x position; can be any finite float
      seed - any int; must be the same between calls for the noise to be continuous
      Returns:
      a noise value between -1.0f and 1.0f, both inclusive
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if 1D noise cannot be produced by this generator

    • getNoiseWithSeed

      public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, float y, int seed)
      Gets 2D noise with a specific seed. If the seed cannot be retrieved or changed per-call, then this falls back to getNoise(float); you can check if this will happen with canUseSeed().
      Parameters:
      x - x position; can be any finite float
      y - y position; can be any finite float
      seed - any int; must be the same between calls for the noise to be continuous
      Returns:
      a noise value between -1.0f and 1.0f, both inclusive
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if 2D noise cannot be produced by this generator

    • getNoiseWithSeed

      public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, float y, float z, float w, float u, float v, int seed)

    • writeToJsonValue

      public void writeToJsonValue(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue modifying)
      Writes the state of this GdxRandom instance into a String JsonValue. This overload does not write to a child of the given JsonValue, and instead sets the JsonValue directly.
      Parameters:
      modifying - the JsonValue that will have this added as a child using the given key name

    • readFromJsonValue

      public void readFromJsonValue(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue value)
      Reads the state of this GdxRandom instance from a String JsonValue.
      Parameters:
      value - the JsonValue that this will look the given key name up in

      Writes the state of this GdxRandom instance into a String child of the given JsonValue.
      Parameters:
      parent - the JsonValue that will have this added as a child using the given key name
      key - the name to store the GdxRandom into

    • readFromJsonValue

      public void readFromJsonValue(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue parent, String key)
      Reads the state of this GdxRandom instance from a String child of the given JsonValue.
      Parameters:
      parent - the JsonValue that this will look the given key name up in
      key - the name to read the GdxRandom data from
